data.title: Buffalo LS220D NAS and OpenLink
data.meta_description:

data.text:
Hiya,

I have a Buffalo Linkstation LS220D which doesn't support NFS and I need it to... (for connection to a phone system for call recording storage). I believe a way round this is to install OpenLink onto the NAS but the instructions at this point overwhelm me.

Could someone simplify it please as I tried downloading an official firmware and what I believe I need - the LS2 version of OpenLink but I haven't a clue how to get it to flash it.

I'm basing it off here - http://buffalo.nas-central.org/wiki/OpenLink and I think I'm using MIPSeL.

My Linux knowledge is nowhere near what it needs to be to figure this out.

Cheers.
